definition: (originally) to provide assistance/(more recently) to show one's support (for a singing idol etc)
surname Ying
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
to help/to assist/to aid

sentences.english: The funds will be used to support and purchase server and gifts.
sentences.chinese: 資金用於應援，服務器，禮物購置。

sentences.english: Do not organise events that violate fire-safety regulations. ie Don't burn the concert down.
sentences.chinese: 請不要組織違反防火條例的應援活動。

sentences.english: Let us do the best to be brothers SJ aid bar.
sentences.chinese: 讓我們做SJ哥哥們最好的應援吧。

sentences.english: All we want is that show you the music support of "pure sapphire" .
sentences.chinese: 只是想爲咱們所愛的人做“純寶藍色”的音樂應援。

definition: spin-off merchandise
meet and greet
Internet celebrity
to boost support or interest/to campaign/to promote
dummy run/to run through sth/to rehearse
to inflate/to pump up/fig. to encourage/to boost morale
to celebrate a heroic deed
variant of 策劃|策划[ce4 hua4]
to announce/to read (the news)
to fulfill one's dream/(divination) to predict the future by interpreting a dream/oneiromancy
voice actor (loanword from Japanese 声優 seiyū)
to go on stage/fig. to appear on the scene/used in advertising to mean new product
charity event/public service activities
party (loanword)
to call for entries and select the best/to solicit (entries, submissions, applications etc)/to select (the best candidate)/contest/competition
to offer flowers/to lay flowers (as a memorial)
